thread.title: Axed, chopped, sacked and more: Brits love the firing line
thread.title_full: Axed, chopped, sacked and more: Brits love the firing line - San Francisco Chronicle

title: Axed, chopped, sacked and more: Brits love the firing line
text:
Photo: Justin Tallis, AFP / Getty Images Fingers have been pointing at Chelsea’s Jose Mourinho. Fingers have been pointing at Chelsea’s Jose Mourinho.
Being the manager of a Premier League team is like being a tree waiting to be axed. The English football culture is obsessed with cutting down its coaches. And club owners duly oblige the desire. It has become a tradition like dancing around the Maypole or the love of warm beer. Fingers have been pointing at Chelsea’s Jose Mourinho. Fingers have been pointing at Chelsea’s Jose Mourinho.
